meanings.definition: A person who makes a claim or assertion, especially in a legal context.
meanings.sent1: The claimant presented their case in court confidently.
meanings.sent2: The insurance company received a claim from the claimant.
meanings.sent3: The claimant joked that they should claim the title of 'Best Complainer'.
meanings.sent4: She was the claimant of the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent5: The claimant's voice echoed through the courtroom as they made their claim.

meanings.definition: One who asserts a right or title to something.
meanings.sent1: The claimant insisted on their right to the property.
meanings.sent2: The claimant of the lost wallet was overjoyed to have it returned.
meanings.sent3: The claimant playfully claimed the title of 'Chief Snack Eater'.
meanings.sent4: He was the claimant of the highest score in the game.
meanings.sent5: The claimant proudly displayed the title deed as proof of ownership.
